Package info.kgeorgiy.ja.koloskov.implementor

Class ClassImplementor

java.lang.Object
info.kgeorgiy.ja.koloskov.implementor.ClassImplementor
public class ClassImplementor extends Object
The ClassImplementor class generates an implementation for a given class or interface.

This class creates a concrete implementation of the provided class or interface. In both cases (class or interface), all abstract methods, including those from parent classes, are implemented.

When the target is a class, in addition to implementing all abstract methods, the generated implementation will also attempt to provide constructors to properly instantiate the class, based on its available constructors.

  • Field Details

    • CLASS_VALIDATION_RULES

      private static final List<ClassImplementor.Rule> CLASS_VALIDATION_RULES
      List of rules used to validate whether a class can be implemented.

      Contains a list of Predicate<Class<?>> rules along with an associated error message to be thrown as an exception if the rule is violated. These rules are used for validating the targetClass in the constructor, and exceptions are thrown if any of the rules fail.

    • targetClass

      private final Class<?> targetClass
      The target class to be implemented.

    • methods

      private final Set<ClassImplementor.MethodWrapper> methods
      A set of abstract methods that need to be implemented.

    • constructors

      private final List<ClassImplementor.ConstructorWrapper> constructors
      A list of available constructors for the implementation.

    • name

      private final String name
      The name of the generated implementation class.

  • Constructor Details

    • ClassImplementor

      public ClassImplementor(Class<?> clazz) throws ImplerException
      Constructs a ClassImplementor for the specified class, generating an implementation with the default name (class name + "Impl").
      Parameters:
      clazz - the target class to be implemented
      Throws:
      ImplerException - if the class cannot be implemented due to validation or other issues

    • ClassImplementor

      public ClassImplementor(Class<?> clazz, String name) throws ImplerException
      Constructs a ClassImplementor for the specified class, generating an implementation with a custom name for the implementation class.

      The constructor performs the validation of the target class and collects abstract methods and constructors (if the class is not an interface). If the class cannot be implemented due to the rules, an ImplerException is thrown.

      Parameters:
      clazz - the target class to be implemented
      name - the name of the generated implementation class
      Throws:
      ImplerException - if the class cannot be implemented, such as when no constructors are available or the class fails validation

      Validates whether the target class can be implemented rules in CLASS_VALIDATION_RULES.
      Parameters:
      clazz - the target class to be checked
      Throws:
      ImplerException - if the class violates implementation constraints

    • validateMethods

      private void validateMethods() throws ImplerException
      Validates whether the collected methods are implementable.
      Throws:
      ImplerException - if a method has a private return type or private parameter

    • collectAbstractMethods

      private void collectAbstractMethods(Class<?> clazz)
      Collects all abstract methods from the given class and its superclasses.

      This method scans public and declared methods to collect all abstract methods that require implementation. Final methods are tracked separately and excluded from the final set of methods to be implemented.

      The ClassImplementor.MethodWrapper class is used to correctly compare methods, ensuring that methods with the same signature are considered identical. Two methods are treated as the same if they have the same name, parameter types, and return type compatibility.

      Parameters:
      clazz - the target class whose abstract methods should be implemented

    • hasPrivateParameter

      private boolean hasPrivateParameter(Parameter[] params)
      Checks whether a method has private parameters.
      Parameters:
      params - the method parameters
      Returns:
      true if the method has at least one private parameter; otherwise, false

    • collectAvailableConstructors

      Collects all available constructors that can be used in the implementation.
